QAestro

Ontology-based Orchestration of Question Answering Pipelines

Home QA systems & tasks QA components QAestro results GitHub project

QAestro results

QA Developer Requirements

The following 30 QA developer requirements were tested for standalone QA tasks and QA pipelines. These pipelines integrate two, three, four, or five QA tasks. The link QA orchestrations directs to the possible orchestrations that QAestro produces given the specific requirement.

with one QA Task

Q1: q(Z2,Z3) :- disambiguation(Z1,Z2,Z3,Z4) -> QA orchestrations

Q2: q(Z1,Z2) :- recognition(Z1,Z2) -> QA orchestrations

Q3: q(Z1,Z2) :- tokenization(Z1,Z2) -> QA orchestrations

Q4: q(Z1,Z2) :- postagging(Z1,Z2) -> QA orchestrations

Q5: q(Z1,Z2) :- dependencyparser(Z1,Z2,Z3,Z4) -> QA orchestrations

Q6: q(Z4) :- syntacticparser(Z1,Z2,Z3,Z4) -> QA orchestrations

Q7: q(Z2,Z7) :- triplegen(Z1,Z2,Z3,Z4,Z5,Z6,Z7) -> QA orchestrations

Q8: q(Z5) :- datamapper(Z1,Z2,Z3,Z4,Z5,Z6,Z7,Z8,Z9,Z10,Z11,Z12,Z13) -> QA orchestrations

Q9: q(Z3,Z8) :- querygen(Z1,Z2,Z3,Z4,Z5,Z6,Z7,Z8) -> QA orchestrations

Q10: q(Z1,Z3) :- answergen(Z1,Z2,Z3) -> QA orchestrations

Q11: q(Z1,Z3) :- answertypeid(Z1,Z2,Z3) -> QA orchestrations

with two QA Tasks

Q12: q(Z1,Z3) :- recognition(Z2,Z1), disambiguation(Z1,Z2,Z3,Z4) -> QA orchestrations

Q13: q(Z2) :- recognition(Z5,Z6), disambiguation(Z1,Z2,Z3,Z4) -> QA orchestrations

Q14: q(Z6,Z10) :- datamapper(Z1,Z2,Z3,Z4,Z5,Z6,Z7,Z8,Z9,Z10,Z11,Z12,Z13), answergen(Z10,Z14,Z15) -> QA orchestrations

Q15: q(Z6) :- datamapper(Z1,Z2,Z3,Z4,Z5,Z6,Z7,Z8,Z9,Z10,Z11,Z12,Z13), answergen(Z10,Z14,Z15) -> QA orchestrations

Q16: q(Z2) :- dependencyparser(Z2,Z8,Z9,Z10), triplegen(Z1,Z2,Z3,Z4,Z5,Z6,Z7) -> QA orchestrations

Q17: q(Z2) :- triplegen(Z1,Z2,Z3,Z4,Z5,Z6,Z7), datamapper(Z2,Z8,Z9,Z0,Z10,Z11,Z12,Z13,Z14,Z15,Z16,Z17,Z18) -> QA orchestrations

Q18: q(Z1,Z2) :- tokenization(Z1,Z2), postagging(Z1,Z2,Z3) -> QA orchestrations

Q19: q(Z8) :- querygen(Z1,Z2,Z3,Z4,Z5,Z6,Z7,Z8), answergen(Z9,Z8,Z10) -> QA orchestrations

Q20: q(Z3,Z8) :- querygen(Z1,Z2,Z3,Z4,Z5,Z6,Z7,Z8), answertypeid(Z9,Z8,Z10) -> QA orchestrations

with three QA Tasks

Q21: q(Z1,Z2) :- recognition(Z2,Z3), disambiguation(Z1,Z2,Z3,Z4), querygen(Z6,Z7,Z8,Z9,Z10,Z11,Z12,Z13) -> QA orchestrations

Q22: q(Z2,Z3) :- recognition(Z2,Z3), disambiguation(Z1,Z2,Z3,Z4), querygen(Z6,Z7,Z8,Z9,Z10,Z11,Z12,Z13) -> QA orchestrations

Q23: q(Z2,Z3) :- disambiguation(Z1,Z2,Z3,Z4), querygen(Z6,Z7,Z8,Z9,Z10,Z11,Z12,Z13), answergen(Z14,Z13,Z15) -> QA orchestrations

Q24: q(Z1,Z2) :- disambiguation(Z1,Z2,Z3,Z4), querygen(Z6,Z7,Z8,Z9,Z10,Z11,Z12,Z13), answergen(Z14,Z13,Z15) -> QA orchestrations

Q25: q(Z2,Z3) :- tokenization(Z2,Z5), recognition(Z2,Z3), disambiguation(Z1,Z2,Z3,Z4) -> QA orchestrations

Q26: q(Z2,Z3) :- postagging(Z2,Z8,Z9),recognition(Z2,Z3), disambiguation(Z1,Z2,Z3,Z4) -> QA orchestrations

with four QA Tasks

Q27: q(Z2,Z3) :- tokenization(Z2,Z5), recognition(Z2,Z3), disambiguation(Z1,Z2,Z3,Z4), answertypeid(Z2,Z6,Z7) -> QA orchestrations

Q28: q(Z2,Z3) :- tokenization(Z2,Z5), recognition(Z2,Z3), disambiguation(Z1,Z2,Z3,Z4), dependencyparser(Z2,Z1,Z6,Z7) -> QA orchestrations

with five QA Tasks

Q29: q(Z2,Z9,Z3) :- tokenization(Z2,Z5), recognition(Z2,Z3), disambiguation(Z1,Z2,Z3,Z4), dependencyparser(Z2,Z1,Z6,Z7), answergen(Z8,Z9,Z10) -> QA orchestrations

Q30: q(Z2,Z3) :- tokenization(Z2,Z5), recognition(Z2,Z3), disambiguation(Z1,Z2,Z3,Z4), dependencyparser(Z2,Z1,Z6,Z7), answertypeid(Z2,Z8,Z9) -> QA orchestrations
